intro: Neanotis ingrata, commonly known as the bitterleaf arrowhead, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence known as a spadix, surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. The plant is known for its dark green, arrowhead-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Neanotis ingrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
